author: Staff Reporter
text:
The NDA government headed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi is taking proactive steps to conduct jallikkattu this year. The efforts of the government will be not be revealed openly as it might favour a few, Union Minister of State for Road Transport, Highways and Shipping Pon. Radhakrishnan said here on Sunday.

Addressing reporters at his residence here, Mr. Radhakrishnan said that he personally was taking steps for lifting the ban on jallikkattu, a sport linked to cultural sentiments of the Tamils.

As part of the effort, one of the organisers, P. Rajasekaran, was taken to New Delhi for a meeting with the Minister concerned.

BJP contention unacceptable: Congress

Meanwhile, Tamil Nadu Congress Committee president E.V.K.S. Elangovan criticised the Centre for backtracking on its promise.

The BJP’s contention that animal rights activists might oppose the move for not keeping up its promise cannot be accepted. Recalling that Mr. Radhakrishnan had been talking about the efforts taken by the Centre for the conduct of jallikattu, Mr. Elangovan wondered whether the Union Minister would resign if he failed to keep up his promise.
title: Centre taking steps to conduct jallikkattu: BJP
